title: Samosas Recipe
description: Create this tea time classic at home! Roll out a fresh dough, fill in your likings and fry crisp! Serve with mint and tamarind chutney and savour!
Ingredients: Filling of your choice (keema, potatoes etc)
method: 1. Mix the refined flour, salt and oil. Add water and knead into a firm but pliable dough.
2. Make into 8-10 smooth balls. Roll into thin rounds, about 15cm/6' in diameter, and cut into halves.
3. Take one half, wet the edges, and fold the straight edge at the center to bring the two halves together, overlapping a bit to form into a triangular case.
4. Press the overlapping portion, and fill the case with the filling, leaving a margin of 1cm/ 1/2 inch all around.
5. Press the edges together to seal the samosas
6. Fill all the pieces in the same manner, keeping them covered with a damp cloth.
7. Heat oil till a piece of dough thrown in, comes up immediately.
8. Add as many samosas as come in without touching each other.
9. Lower the heat to medium. Fry to a golden brown on either side. Serve hot, with a chutney.

title: Soya Idli Recipe
description: This recipe of idli involves soybean along with rice and urad dal- which makes the whole recipe enriched with good protein.
method: Firstly, soak dal, rice and soyabean separately in bowls.
Add methi seeds and chana dal together in the bowl of urad dal. Soak the rice atleast 5-6 hours.
Once soaked, grind all the ingredients together into a thick and consistent paste. Add a little bit of water and grind again.
Add the salt and stir well to combine. Cover the bowl and ferment the Batter for at least 6 hours or overnight.
Once fermented, mix again. Steam in an idli steamer and serve hot with sambar and nariyal ki chutney alongside.
key_ingredients: Soyabean, White Urad Dal, Fenugreek Seeds, Idli Rice, Chana Dal, Salt

title: Goli Idli Recipe
description: Rice balls steamed, cooked and served with your favorite tomato chutney. This innovative goli idli recipe is so easy to make and requires just a few ingredients.
Ingredients: 1 and a half tsp Chana dal
method: Boil water in a pan, add salt and ghee. Now, add rice flour, and let the water completely soak in.
Let it cool down a little and then make soft dough. Add hot water if required.
Make small balls out of the dough and steam them for 10-15 minutes.
Heat oil in another pan, add urad dal, chana dal, mustard seeds, green chilli, curry leaves, sesame seeds and ginger. Let them splutter for 2-3 minutes.
Add idli and mix it well with the mixture.
Garnish with coriander leaves and enjoy!
key_ingredients: Water , Salt , Ghee, Rice Flour, Oil, Mustard seeds, Chana dal, Urad dal , Sesame seeds, Dried red chilli, Curry leaves , chopped chilli, Ginger paste

title: Egg Samosa Recipe
description: This samosa recipe is stuffed with a masala mixture of carrots, potatoes and eggs, making it crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
method: In a bowl mix together maida, baking powder and salt. Add onion seeds and oil. Knead into a smooth dough. Allow it to rest for 1-2 hours.
Heat oil in a pan and then saute the onions and green chillies until onions turn golden-pink. Add the grated potatoes and carrots. Stir-fry for a minute.
Add salt, and coriander leaves. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or till the potatoes are soft and mushy.
Now break the eggs into the pan and cook until the eggs are done. Remove from fire and allow it to cool.
Make small balls of the dough and roll them into thin and small chapatis.
Place the egg mixture and shape them into small/medium triangles. Seal the edges with little water.
Deep fry the prepared samosas in small batches until golden brown. Remove and drain excess oil.
Serve hot with ketchup, onion rings and the chutney of your choice!
key_ingredients: Eggs, Grated Potato , Chopped Green Chillies, Baking Powder, Salt as required , Finely Chopped Onion, Onion Seeds, Coriander Leaves, All Purpose Flour, Refined Oil

title: Bread Dahi Chaat Recipe
description: We bring you an easy and delicious recipe of bread Dahi chaat! As the name suggests, this chaat is made with a mix of crispy bread, and the classic flavours of chaat to give you a zing in the taste!
method: Take five to six pieces of bread and cut them in small bite size pieces.
Now you can either choose to bake it or pan fry it till crispy.
Once it is done let it come till room temperature and then add it to a bowl.
To this, now add yoghurt, green chutney, imly chutney, boiled potatoes and boiled chana. Mix again.
Next, add spices like pepper, red chilli powder, chaat masala and salt as per taste and combine again.
Lastly, add pomegranate and sev or bhujia from the top to relish!
key_ingredients: Bread, Yoghurt , Green chutney , Imly chutney  , Red Chilli Powder , Pepper , Chaat Masala , Salt as per taste

title: Aloo Poha Recipe
description: This recipe is as simple as it can get. This is for the lazy day's when you wake up late and don't feel like cooking anything. All you need to do is wash some poha, add boiled potatoes along with flavourful spices, mix it together and this simple delicacy is ready to relish!
method: Heat oil in a pan and saute mustard seeds, onions, curry leaves, peanuts and green chillies.
Once the onions are translucent, add potatoes, haldi and salt(according to taste).
Wash your poha, drain it and add it to the pan. Mix well. Keep on flame till its cooked.
Once the poha is ready, garnish it with coriander and lemon juice.
key_ingredients: Boiled Potatoes, Chopped onions, Poha, Chopped Green Chillies, Mustard Seeds, Curry leaves, Peanuts, Oil, Haldi Powder, Salt

title: Dahi Samosa Chaat Recipe
description: Made with rich freshly grounded spices, crispy aloo samosa and a lot of dahi, this chaat is surely to die for.
method: Firstly, prepare the knead by using maida, carrom seeds, salt and water. Set it aside for at least 15 minutes.
Mash some boiled potatoes along with matar, green chillies and all the dry spices. Mix everything well.
Now, take a small portion from the dough, roll it and stuff it with the aloo filling. Seal all the sides and drop them into the kadhai of hot oil. Fry until the samosa turns crispy and golden.
Transfer the samosa on a plate, pour beaten curd, chutneys, sprinkle some chaat masala, coriander leaves and sev on the top.
Your samosa chaat is ready to relish
key_ingredients: Maida, Mashed potato, Matar (optional), Garam Masala, Chaat Masala, Salt, Imli Ki Chutney, Mint Chutney, Dahi, Oil To Fry, Red Chilli Powder, Chopped Green Chillies, Black salt, Coriander Leaves, Sev To Garnish
